powertrains.description: Engine/motor types with typical layout, power, cylinders, and energy types; notes cover longitudinal/transverse and hub motors.

types.name: Gasoline ICE

typical_cylinders_layout.name: I3
typical_cylinders_layout.examples: Ford EcoBoost 1.0L, BMW i8, Smart Fortwo

typical_cylinders_layout.name: I4
typical_cylinders_layout.examples: Honda Civic 1.5L, Toyota Camry 2.5L, VW Golf 2.0L

typical_cylinders_layout.name: I6
typical_cylinders_layout.examples: BMW 3.0L I6, Mercedes C300 3.0L, Toyota Supra 3.0L

typical_cylinders_layout.name: V4
typical_cylinders_layout.examples: Porsche 718 Boxster 2.0L, Saab 99 2.0L (historical)

typical_cylinders_layout.name: V6
typical_cylinders_layout.examples: BMW 3.0L, Mercedes C-Class 3.0L, Audi A6 3.0L

typical_cylinders_layout.name: V8
typical_cylinders_layout.examples: BMW M3 4.0L, Mercedes AMG 4.0L, Chevrolet Corvette 6.2L

typical_cylinders_layout.name: V12
typical_cylinders_layout.examples: BMW 760i 6.6L, Mercedes S600 6.0L, Ferrari 812 Superfast 6.5L

typical_cylinders_layout.name: W12
typical_cylinders_layout.examples: Audi A8 6.0L, Bentley Continental GT 6.0L, VW Phaeton 6.0L

types.notes: Transverse commonly in FWD compacts; longitudinal in RWD/AWD and performance cars.

types.name: Diesel ICE

typical_cylinders_layout.name: I4
typical_cylinders_layout.examples: VW TDI 2.0L, BMW 320d 2.0L, Mercedes C220d 2.0L

typical_cylinders_layout.name: I5
typical_cylinders_layout.examples: Audi TDI 2.5L (discontinued), Volvo D5 2.4L

typical_cylinders_layout.name: I6
typical_cylinders_layout.examples: BMW 330d 3.0L I6, Mercedes E350d 3.0L I6, Land Rover Defender 3.0L

typical_cylinders_layout.name: V6
typical_cylinders_layout.examples: BMW 330d 3.0L, Mercedes E350d 3.0L, Audi A6 3.0L TDI

typical_cylinders_layout.name: V8
typical_cylinders_layout.examples: BMW 750d 4.4L, Mercedes GLS 450d 4.0L, Audi Q7 4.0L TDI

types.notes: Favored in EU for efficiency and torque; used in SUVs and long-distance cars.

types.name: Mild Hybrid MHEV
types.description: ICE with 12–48V belt-integrated starter-generator for assist and regen.

typical_cylinders_layout.name: I3
typical_cylinders_layout.examples: Ford EcoBoost 1.0L MHEV, Suzuki Swift 1.0L MHEV

typical_cylinders_layout.name: I4
typical_cylinders_layout.examples: Mercedes C200 MHEV 2.0L, BMW 320i MHEV 2.0L

typical_cylinders_layout.name: I6
typical_cylinders_layout.examples: BMW 330i MHEV 3.0L I6, Mercedes C300 MHEV 3.0L I6

typical_cylinders_layout.name: V6
typical_cylinders_layout.examples: Mercedes E350 MHEV 3.0L, BMW 540i MHEV 3.0L

typical_cylinders_layout.name: V8
typical_cylinders_layout.examples: Mercedes S560 MHEV 4.0L, BMW 750i MHEV 4.4L

types.notes: Does not propel vehicle on electric power alone.

types.name: Full Hybrid HEV
types.description: ICE plus electric motor and small traction battery; limited EV-only operation.

typical_cylinders_layout.name: I3
typical_cylinders_layout.examples: Toyota Prius 1.5L Hybrid, Honda Insight 1.5L Hybrid

typical_cylinders_layout.name: I4
typical_cylinders_layout.examples: Toyota Camry Hybrid 2.5L, Honda Accord Hybrid 2.0L, Ford Fusion Hybrid 2.0L

typical_cylinders_layout.name: I6
typical_cylinders_layout.examples: Lexus LS 500h 3.5L I6, BMW 330e 3.0L I6 Hybrid

typical_cylinders_layout.name: V6
typical_cylinders_layout.examples: Lexus RX 450h 3.5L, Acura MDX Hybrid 3.0L

types.name: Plug-in Hybrid PHEV
types.description: Hybrid with external charging and larger battery enabling substantial EV range.

typical_cylinders_layout.name: I4
typical_cylinders_layout.examples: BMW 330e 2.0L PHEV, Volvo XC60 T8 2.0L PHEV, Mitsubishi Outlander PHEV 2.4L

typical_cylinders_layout.name: I6
typical_cylinders_layout.examples: BMW 530e 3.0L I6 PHEV, Mercedes E350e 3.0L I6 PHEV

typical_cylinders_layout.name: V6
typical_cylinders_layout.examples: Porsche Panamera E-Hybrid 2.9L, BMW 745e 3.0L PHEV, Mercedes S560e 3.0L PHEV

typical_cylinders_layout.name: V8
typical_cylinders_layout.examples: Porsche Cayenne Turbo S E-Hybrid 4.0L, BMW X5 xDrive50e 4.4L PHEV

types.notes: Can drive significant distances in EV mode; AC charging standard.

types.name: Series Hybrid
types.description: ICE acts as generator; electric motor drives wheels.

typical_cylinders_layout.name: I3
typical_cylinders_layout.examples: BMW i3 REx 0.6L, Fisker Karma 2.0L (discontinued)

typical_cylinders_layout.name: I4
typical_cylinders_layout.examples: Chevrolet Volt 1.5L (discontinued), BMW i3 REx 0.6L

typical_cylinders_layout.name: I6
typical_cylinders_layout.examples: BMW i8 1.5L I6 (generator), Mazda MX-30 R-EV 0.8L I6 (generator)

types.notes: Engine decoupled from wheels; smooth power delivery.

types.name: BEV
types.description: Battery electric vehicle using one or more electric motors.

typical_cylinders_layout.name: motors
typical_cylinders_layout.examples: Tesla Model 3 (1-2 motors), Tesla Model S (1-3 motors), BMW iX (2 motors), Audi e-tron (2 motors)

types.notes: No cylinders; motors may be axle-mounted; hub motors exist but uncommon.

types.name: Fuel Cell FCEV
types.description: Hydrogen fuel cell generates electricity for motors.

typical_cylinders_layout.name: motors
typical_cylinders_layout.examples: Toyota Mirai (1 motor), Honda Clarity Fuel Cell (1 motor), Hyundai Nexo (1 motor)

types.name: Range Extender EV
types.description: BEV with small ICE generator solely to extend range.

typical_cylinders_layout.name: I2
typical_cylinders_layout.examples: BMW i3 REx 0.6L (generator), Fisker Karma 2.0L (generator)

typical_cylinders_layout.name: I3
typical_cylinders_layout.examples: BMW i3 REx 0.6L (generator), Mazda MX-30 R-EV 0.8L (generator)

typical_cylinders_layout.name: I4
typical_cylinders_layout.examples: Chevrolet Volt 1.5L (generator), BMW i3 REx 0.6L (generator)

typical_cylinders_layout.name: I6
typical_cylinders_layout.examples: BMW i8 1.5L I6 (generator), Mazda MX-30 R-EV 0.8L I6 (generator)

types.notes: Wheels driven only by electric motor.

layouts_reference.transverse_engine: Engine crankshaft perpendicular to travel; common in FWD; compact packaging.
layouts_reference.longitudinal_engine: Engine crankshaft parallel to travel; common in RWD/AWD; allows larger engines.
layouts_reference.hub_motor: Electric motors integrated in wheels; rare in mass-market passenger cars.
